extendedInfo.description: The FUJIFILM Camera Application is an application provided by FUJIFILM that can be used to copy up to 30 images at a time from wireless-equipped digital cameras to smartphones or tablets and to view the pictures on the camera on large smartphone or tablet displays.[Supported Cameras]FUJIFILM FinePix F900EXR, FinePix F800EXR, FinePix XP200 and FinePix S8400W[Smartphone System Requirements]Android Smartphone/Tablet: Android OS Ver.2.2 to 4.1[Using FUJIFILM Camera Application]Uploading Multiple Pictures to a Smartphone1.Launch the FUJIFILM Camera Application app.2.Tap Receive Pictures.3.[Camera] In the playback menu, select WIRELESS IMAGE TRANSFER > SEND SELECTED MULTIPLE IMAGES.4.[Camera] Highlight images and press OK to select or deselect.5.[Camera] Press BACK when your selection is complete.6.Place the camera and smartphone as close together as possible and operate both devices simultaneously. [Camera] Highlight?OK and press OK. [Smartphone] Tap  CONNECT. 7.After checking the name of the device to which the camera is connected, press OK.Browsing the Camera from a Smartphone1.Launch the FUJIFILM Camera Application app.2.Tap Browse Camera.3.Place the camera and smartphone as close together as possible and operate both devices simultaneously. [Camera] In the playback menu, select WIRELESS IMAGE TRANSFER > VIEW & OBTAIN IMAGES ON. [Smartphone] Tap  CONNECT. 4.After checking the name of the device to which the camera is connected, press OK.Downloading Location Data from a Smartphone1.Launch the FUJIFILM Camera Application app.2.Tap Geotagging.3.Place the camera and smartphone as close together as possible and operate both devices simultaneously.[Camera] Select GEOTAGGING SET-UP > LOCATION INFO SEARCH.[Smartphone] Tap  CONNECT. 4.After checking the name of the device to which the camera is connected, press OK.

reviews.title: Barely works.
reviews.comment: Impossible to connect when close to a saved wireless network.  Difficult to connect in browse camera mode most times. Takes ages and lots of phone battery to download multiple photos. Frequent crashing.
reviews.author: Dale Wark

reviews.title: Never Been Able to Connect
reviews.comment: Such a disappointment. Never got it work on Galaxy Nexus 4.2.2 with Fujifilm F900exr. Please fix!!!  Update1: After uninstalling both this app and Fujifilm Photo Receiver, re-install this app and restart my phone, finally it now works!
reviews.author: Day John

reviews.title: Very good application
reviews.comment: I used this with my Xperia Z and finepix XP200 and it\'s work very good...
reviews.author: Ehab Hassan Mohamed Hassan

reviews.title: No frills, no problems.
reviews.comment: It works well with my Galaxy S4 and F900 EXR. There\'s roughly a 10 second wait for the camera and smartphone to connect to each other, and it takes just a few seconds to transfer each pic (depending on pic size). The app even turns on your WiFi signal for you if you haven\'t turned it on yet. Overall the app has a simple and clean interface, easy operation, and does the trick.
reviews.author: Rodney Basconcillo

reviews.title: Useless!
reviews.comment: Connects 1/10 times back to back. Slow and crashes all the time.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Does what it says it will do.
reviews.comment: This app is easy to use, and it allows you to look at your pix on your phone while deciding which ones to keep in your phone gallery (Droid Razr HD.) However, the fact that it groups the photos that you decide to keep on your phone in random order is a problem.    The photos are obviously in order on my camera. Why change that? Other than that glitch, the app is functional. Update: Camera is Fujifilm Finepix f800exr.
reviews.author: David Bright

reviews.title: Not working at all with X-M1
reviews.comment: The other App by Fujifilm, Photo Receiver, works just fine. This one simply doesn\'t talk to the X-M1.
reviews.author: Ewen Bell

reviews.title: Fujifilm hs30exr
reviews.comment: Is this application work on my hs30exr?
reviews.author: Wooow22 never back down

reviews.title: need help
reviews.comment: i need to use this application on finepix 3400
reviews.author: Moussa Rashaideh

reviews.title: Wireless works but the pictures are lost
reviews.comment: I just used this with my HTC Evo 3D and it easily transferred my images to the phone.   The problem is that I can\'t find them - they are not in the gallery.  I then hooked up the phone as a drive to my computer, and found the transferred pictures in a sub-folder:   FUJIFILM > PHOTO RECEIVER > (images all here).  How am I supposed to access that without my computer?  I need these to be in the phone gallery so that I can share them.    Can anyone help?   Thanks.
reviews.author: hal roadtripping

reviews.title: Works as described. GPS from phone to camera
reviews.comment: [Updated review] My main use for the app is to supply the camera with GPS coordinates. The F800 EXR does not have on-board GPS (the previous F770 model had GPS though) but can get coordinates by wifi from a smartphone. The camera stores the downloaded GPS coordinates for max 3 hrs then forgets it. If exact location is critical for you, you need to download the coordinates to the camera from the phone each time you move to a new location. The app has very low  drain on battery,  it\'s not noticeable. A feature is the ability to transfer photos by wifi to the cell phone (but why not take pics with the cell phone?). Feature request: periodic automatic download of GPS coordinates to camera, say every 5 or 10 minutes (user set-able).   Update: camera and phone need to be touching each other for reliable wifi connections, if not touching, connection takes many re-tries. The ideal camera has both wifi and GPS. Bump to 5 stars not that I understand \"bring devices close together\" means \"devices touching\". Camera acts as a very low power wifi hotspot that the camera connects.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Ok but no remote shutter
reviews.comment: Not a bad application for photo transfer but would be an amazing application if you could remotely trigger the shutter like other manufacturers.
reviews.author: Simon Phillips

reviews.title: Doesn\'t work
reviews.comment: Guys I love Fuji products. To my amazement I found the Fuji products. The unfortunately it doesn\'t work with my Nexus 7. I will be very happy when this gets to working
reviews.author: John C Pickens

reviews.title: Great Technology..!
reviews.comment: Love this app it works a treat with my HTC Desire S.
reviews.author: Cee Critch
